Hi! I’m Arumugam Ramaswamy - Aru for short. I’m currently a Robotics software engineer at Eureka Robotics. When not building things that intrigue me, you can find me at a bouldering gym trying really hard to send my project.

title: Math is hard: An introduction to parsing
text:
This is a post with executable code.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()




Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis
